metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2879 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Reader.Read does not set a limit on the maximum size of file headers. Amaliciously crafted archive could cause Read to allocate unbounded amountsof memory, potentially causing resource exhaustion or panics. After fix,Reader.Read limits the maximum size of header blocks to 1 MiB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2879` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
No subscription required

golang-1.13 - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2
golang-1.13-go - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2
golang-1.13-src - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

golang-1.16 - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1
golang-1.16-go - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1
golang-1.16-src - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.18 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2').
golang-1.13 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2').
golang-1.16 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1').
